utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Listen, do you guys think I have a chance with Janine?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, we have been through this before!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Don’t do this to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She’s made it pretty clear, it is not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well all right then, I guess I shouldn’t get to excited about the fact that I just kissed her!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You serious?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s great!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah well, we’ll see.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You kissed her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh we kissed it up real nice.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So you kissed her, so what happened after that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I came over here to tell you guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So she’s just waiting over there for ya?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I’m gonna be really late for dance class!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Okay, now I’m really late.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, I’m all right, okay, but hey, could you just leave your lips?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Have you kissed her yet? It’s awesome! I could do it forever! Y’know what? She-she kisses better than my mom cooks!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am so glad you said cooks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh hey Rachel, sweetheart? You have got to tell the post office that you have moved. Okay? We are still getting all your bills and stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh-oh, Pottery Barn! You can throw the rest away.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not your garbage man. I’m your mailman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica look! Look-look-look! Here is that table that I ordered.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You got it from Pottery Barn?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! It’s an apothecary table. Does anyone even know what an apothecary is?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A pharmacist.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, Phoebe hates Pottery Barn.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I hate Pottery Barn too. They kicked me out of there just because I sat on a bed!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You took off your pants and climbed under the sheets!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I was tired!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe hates Pottery Barn?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, she hates all mass produced stuff. She thinks her furniture should have a history, a story behind it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well this has story behind it! I mean they had to ship it all the way from the White Plains store.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s gotta be one of a kind. Y’know like umm, y’know uh, what’s that God awful ceramic fruit bowl she has on her counter?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I made that for her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You made pottery?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! I made it of this fruit bowl I found in the garbage.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m telling—If you put that in her apartment you’ll never hear the end of it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay fine! I’ll-I’ll just tell her it’s an antique apothecary table, she doesn’t have to know where it came from. Oh! Look at this little drawers! Oh look-look it says that it holds 300 CDs.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, just like the apothecary tables of yore…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: …so then the farmer says, "That’s not a cow and you’re not milking it."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am so glad you guys got together, Chandler and I are always looking for a couple to go out with and now we have one!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look at us, we’re a couple of couples!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I had so much fun tonight, and what a great restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And Chandler I can’t believe I let you pay for this one. Thanks man.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So do you guys gonna come over tomorrow? I’ll make that pasta thing I was telling you about.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Oh that would be great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, but hey look, at least let us bring the wine.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, you don’t have too!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope-op! I insist! You get the wine right?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah all right. Okay, good night guys.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See ya tomorrow!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Tomorrow!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Can’t wait!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: How are we gonna get out of that one?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I can’t handle two nights in a row with them.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I don’t know, they’re just a little blah!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Blah?!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Well y’know, he’s blah, she’s just—she’s very loud for such a small person.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, they’re like my best friends. Are you saying we can’t hang out with them? ‘Cause that would kinda be a problem.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: No! Of course we can still hang out with them. Just y’know, not two nights in a row. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: If you want, I’ll sell my friends and use the money to buy you presents.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, what a great table! Where-where did you get it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Guess!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, a flea market?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ha! See, I knew, I knew you’d get it on the first guess. Isn’t it cool! It’s an apothecary table.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Oh you can just imagine that this is where they kept all the stuff to make their potions.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know? Ooh, you can almost smell the opium.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Almost.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How much was it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It was only 500 bucks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: 500 bucks at a flea market?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, okay see I thought, I thought you meant how much was it when it was new, y’know like back then.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah no, I mean it was at a flea market, so it was y’know, it was like a dollar.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A dollar?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And fifty. So it was like one and fifty dollars.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, okay, they gave you the old time pricing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, what period is it from?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, it’s from yore. Like the days of yore. Y’know?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, yes I do. God, oh it’s just perfect! Wow! I bet it has a great story behind it too. Did they tell you anything? Like y’know where it was from or…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! That I know, this is from White Plains.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: White Plains. Oh, it sounds like such a magical place.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! We’re here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You like it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s my new apothecary table!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross! Phoebe’s gonna be here any second, she cannot see this!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well why not?! She’ll-she’ll love it! It’s the real thing! I got it at Pottery Barn.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know you did! I bought the same one! And if she sees your table she’s gonna know that I lied to her. I told her ours was an original.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because she hates Pottery Barn.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She hates Pottery Barn?!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know! I know, she says it’s all mass-produced, nothing is authentic, and everyone winds up having the same stuff. So come on, she’s gonna be here any second! Can we please just cover this up with something?! Please?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? No! No! I am not gonna hide it from Phoebe—Ooh, although I did get some great Pottery Barn sheets!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooo! Oh, I forgot they made sheets!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, yeah! I still can’t believe she hates Pottery Barn!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, get over it! It’s not like she hates you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah but Pottery Barn! Y’know what I think? It’s just she-she’s weird. Y’know it’s because she’s a twin. Twins are weird.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, she’s not weird, she just wants her stuff to be one of a kind.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh. Y’know what’s not one of a kind? A twin!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, Phoebe’s here! Okay, let’s turn out all the lights and we’ll just watch the movie!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. Hey—Ooh, cool sheets!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, you like it? You wanna know where I got it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He got it a flea market!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You bought your sheets at a flea market? Ross come on, you gotta loosen the purse strings a little.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The dinner will be ready in twenty minutes. This is so exciting.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And here is the bottle of wine for you to bring over tonight. You were also going to buy Monica flowers but you couldn’t afford it, because you paid dinner last night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thanks. Thanks, but uh actually it’s just gonna be me again tonight.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What happened to Janine?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, she’s uh-uh really sick.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s too bad.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s been in there all day , uh high fever, a nose problem… Phlegm! Phlegm! Phlegm-phlegm-phlegm!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Monica! Chandler! I’m really-really sorry about tonight. I don’t know if Joey told you; I just couldn’t get out of going to this play. I’m sorry. Have a great time.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ‘Kay!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s funny, I saw no phlegm.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no, she really is sick!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Then why-why is she going to a play?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, y’know, starve a fever, go to a play for a cold.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey! Why is Janine not coming over for dinner?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well uh, she didn’t want to hang out with you guys two nights in a row. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, why does she not want to hang out with us?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Because she uh, she-she thinks that you are blah and that you, Monica, are too loud.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!! What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So she was just pretending to have a good time last night? She was lying to our faces?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh, I can not believe this! I mean, who is she to judge us? We could not have been nicer to her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And I am not blah, I am a hoot!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know! I know! Come on, please-please you guys, don’t-don’t be mad. I’m sure she just, she just said that stuff because she was nervous and you guys are like my best friends! Y’know? And it was our first date! Plus, she’s really sick!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, you sh—No you said you made that up!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, but don’t you think the sick thing is way better than the play thing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh, they’re both good. I generally just go with, Monica’s drunk again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on you guys, come on please-please just give her another chance, huh? She’ll come around I promise.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Of course we will, come on we gotta make dinner.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I do not like that woman!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can hear you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am loud!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Aww!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s funny.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, could you please not put your feet up on my new……old sheet?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh sure! Noo!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My apothecary table!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noooooo!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross, where did you get this?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I got it at Pottery Barn!! Okay?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God, Phoebe, Pottery Barn has ripped off the design of our antique!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Oh my God, well if they’ve ripped off our table ours must be much more than one and fifty dollars!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well this doesn’t even smell like opium.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course not, it smells like wine, which you spilled! And thanks for wrecking my sheet by the way.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh Ross, calm down, I’ll give you the 80 cents.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, one more time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, would you like some more orange juice?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Perfect decibel.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So uh, what are you guys doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh nothing, we’re just talking. Y’know, blah-blah-blah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, come on you guys, you said you were gonna try! All right look, I came over here to invite you guys to a movie with me and Janine.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I’d like to but, I’m not sure we have time to go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ha-ha, very funny—Look! I don’t know what to do! I really want you guys to get along. Just please come to the movie with us. I mean you owe me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We owe you?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s right! I helped you guys out a lot in the start of your relationship. Huh? I helped you guys sneak around for like six months, and I looked like an idiot! And I was humiliated. And I only made 200 dollars!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We didn’t give you any money!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You don’t think I know that!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: …see I can’t decide whether it would go better next to the new wicker dining chair, the Sahara desk, or the Parker console table.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! I didn’t know that there was a Pottery Barn up here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know, I know. I went a little crazy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A little? Your place looks like page 72 of the catalogue. Oh look at that! The ornamental bird cage! Large!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh Ross no. Be careful, that is very old! Okay? Early Colonial bird merchants used to bring their birds to market in that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Another amazing find! Wow! Oh I bet this has a great story too!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh it does, it does! It is a room separating apparatus from Colonial times.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hmm, a lot of this stuff is from Colonial times. Hey, what are some other time periods Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well there’s yore. And uh, y’know, yesteryear.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah no, I’m telling you Rachel has such a great eye for this stuff. Ross, y’know if you ever decide you need to redecorate—And I think that you should. You should, you should ask Rachel to help.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey he doesn’t need my help.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, come on! I think he’s ready to get rid of, what did you call it? The cheap knock-offs and dinosaur junk.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?! Hey, y’know what? Since you have such a great sense of what I need, uh ooh, here’s-here’s 60 bucks, why don’t you take Phoebe down to that Colonial flea market of yours and get me some stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know what? I don’t, I don’t think Phoebe really wants to come.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! I do want to!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, she does want to.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She does want to.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, I don’t know what to say. I guess the flea market was just better last time.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well at least I got these sheets for Ross.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uck, look at this! Pottery Barn, yuck!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, y’know what? Don’t look at it. Seriously, don’t look at it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Look-look! There’s the coffee table they stole from us!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh, those bastards! Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That fan kinda looks like ours. And the birdcage and the…wait a sec! This is our exact living room!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No! No! No it’s not! No it’s not! Come on! Phoebe, ours is totally different! I mean we don’t have the… We don’t have the…that lamp! And-and that screen is y’know, on the other side.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God. This is where you got all our stuff, Pottery Barn! Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! Okay-okay look—no I did, I just wanted this stuff and I know how you feel about Pottery Barn. Just… Come on don’t be mad.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no-no, but I am mad! I am mad! Because this stuff is everything that is wrong with the world! And it’s all sitting up in my living room and all I can think about is how I don’t have that lamp!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well then honey, buy the lamp! Hey, we have that 60 bucks from Ross.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t! I can’t! Unless… Well are you saying that-that you would move out if-if I didn’t buy that lamp?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! No! I’m not gonna move out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But are you saying that you would move out if I didn’t buy that lamp?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Yes! I would so move out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay then I don’t have a choice! I have to buy that lamp!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But at least the apothecary table is real.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, this-this-this was great. Didn’t everybody have a great time?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Well I did. I really did. And you guys, I’ve got to say, I’m sorry if I was a little weird after the last time we went out. I guess I was just nervous or something.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s totally understandable.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: So we can go out again?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Absolutely!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well then, good night!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Good night!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See? Eh, wasn’t that fun?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: We have got to move!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I knew it!! Y’know, you’re not so quiet yourself, missy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And I’m blah? Listen, the only thing more boring than watching modern dance is having to listen to you talk about it, "Oh Chandler, I just lost myself in the moment."

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Y’know, I know you’re talking, but all I hear is, "Blah. Blah. Blah-blah-blah."

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right! You and me! Let’s go! Right now!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! All right! Enough! Enough! Enough!! Enough! You two go home! I-I-I gotta talk to Janine!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know I think you can take her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’d better hope I don’t see you in the hallway!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, uh, we’ve got a little bit of a problem here. These people are my friends; you can’t treat them that way.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: They said stuff to me too, y’know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know! I know! And I’m going to talk to them about it. They mean so much to me. They… They’re like my family. If you guys are gonna be fighting all the time, I-I… I don’t think we can be together. It just, it just can’t work. It can’t. I’m very upset.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Would, would it help if I went over and apologized?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah! That would be very helpful! Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What did I tell you about the hall?!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I was just coming over here to apologize for my behavior! I’d really like it if we could be friends.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I know that would make Joey happy, so, I would like that too.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now come on. Well, I’m glad we worked things out.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: I’ll see you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Or I’ll hear you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s it big girl! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Wait!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’d better run!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah uh, what am I gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m sorry man. You wanna go watch?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How ya doin’?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey so, did uh, did she move out?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pretty much, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I cannot believe you broke up with her just like that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, when it’s not right, you know it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah. I’ll be all right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know what would cheer you up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m giving this lecture on erosion theories tomorrow night, I think you should come.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re right! That did cheer me up!
